bioconda.name: genonets
bioconda.summary: Framework for creating and analyzing genotype networks from data.

biocontainers.name: genonets
biocontainers.summary: A genotype network is a graph in which vertices represent genotypes that have the same phenotype. this tool provides the following features: (i) the construction of genotype networks for categorical and univariate phenotypes; (ii) analyses of genotype network topology and how it relates to robustness and evolvability, as well as analyses of genotype network topography and how it relates to the navigability of a genotype network; (iii) multiple interactive visualizations.

biotools.summary: A genotype network is a graph in which vertices represent genotypes that have the same phenotype. This tool provides the following features: (i) the construction of genotype networks for categorical and univariate phenotypes; (ii) analyses of genotype network topology and how it relates to robustness and evolvability, as well as analyses of genotype network topography and how it relates to the navigability of a genotype network; (iii) multiple interactive visualizations.

bioschemas.name: Genonets
bioschemas.summary: A genotype network is a graph in which vertices represent genotypes that have the same phenotype. This tool provides the following features: (i) the construction of genotype networks for categorical and univariate phenotypes; (ii) analyses of genotype network topology and how it relates to robustness and evolvability, as well as analyses of genotype network topography and how it relates to the navigability of a genotype network; (iii) multiple interactive visualizations.
